gurmukhi: bwnin swQ ibdwr dey Air qw Cib ko kiv Bwau ibcwirE ]
transliteration: Baanan(i0 Saath Bidaar Dae Ar(i0 Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kav(i0 Bhaau Bichaario||
translation: She hath destroyed the enemy with her arrows; the poet hath imagined it in this manner:

gurmukhi: sUrj kI ikrny sr mwsih ryn Anyk qhwN kr fwirE ]139]
transliteration: Sooraj Koo Kirne Sar Maasah(i) Ren Anek Tahaan Kar Daario||139||
translation: It seems that the arrows are moving like the radiant rays of the sun and the bits of the flesh of the demons are flying here and there like dust.139.

gurmukhi: cMf cmUM bhu dYqn kI hiq Pyir pRcMf kuvMf sMBwirE ]
transliteration: Channd Chamoond Bahu Daitan Koo Hat(i) Pher(i) Prachanndd Kuvand Sanbhaario||
translation: After killing the enormous army of the demons, Chandi hath swiftly held up her bow.

gurmukhi: bwnn so dl Por dieE bl kY br isMG mhwN BBkwirE ]
transliteration: Baanan So Dal Phor Daio Bal Kai Bar Singh Mahaan Bhabhkaario||
translation: She hath torn the forces with her arrows and the mighty lion hath also roared loudly.

gurmukhi: mwr dey isrdwr bfy Dr sRaux bhwie bfo rn pwirE ]
transliteration: Maar Dae Sirdaar Bade Dhar Sraoun Bahaae Bado Ran Paario||
translation: Many chieftains have been killed and the blood is flowing on the ground in this great war.

gurmukhi: eyk ky sIs dieE Dn XO jnu kop ky gwj ky mMfp mwirE ]140]
transliteration: Ek Ke Soos Daio Dhan Yau Jan(u) Kop Ke Gadj Ke Mandap Maario||140||
translation: The head of one demon hath been kicked by the bow thrown away like the lightning desecrating a palace.140.

gurmukhi: cMf cmUM sB dYq kI AYsy deI sMGwr ]
transliteration: Channd Chamoond Sabh Dait Koo Aise Daoo Sanhaar||
translation: Chandi destroyed al the army of the demons in this way;

gurmukhi: paun pUq ijau lMk ko fwirE bwg auKwr ]141]
transliteration: Paoun Poot Jio Lank Ko Daario Baag Oukhaar||141||
translation: Just as Hanuman, the son of wind-god, uprooted the garden of Lanka.141.

gurmukhi: gwj kY cMf mhw bil myG sI bUMdn ijau Ar pY sr fwry ]
transliteration: Gadj Kai Channd Mahaa Bal(i) Megh Soo Boondan Jio Ar Pai Sar Ddare||
translation: Very powerful Chandi, thundering like clouds, hath showered her arrows on the enemy like rain-drops.

gurmukhi: dwmn so Kg lY kir mY bhu bIr ADMDr kY Dr mwry ]
transliteration: Daamanndso Khag Lai Kar(i) Mai Bahu Boor Adhandhar Kai Dhar Mdare||
translation: Taking the lightning-like sword in her hand, she hath cut into halves the trunks of the warriors and thrown them on the ground.

gurmukhi: Gwiel GUm pry iqh ieau aupmw mn mY kiv XO Anuswry ]
transliteration: Ghaail Ghoom Dare Tih Io Oupmaa Man Mai Kav(i) You Anousdare||
translation: The wounded revolve and like this according to the imagination of the poet.
